title: The Portrait of a Lady - foggy square

content.question: In the fourteenth sentence (“It struck her husband . . . should have a greater vagueness”), the image of the “foggy square in London” serves primarily to

choices.label: allude to Mrs. Touchett’s euphemistic way of describing her estrangement from her husband
provide an ironic contrast to the unambiguous nature of the Touchetts’ separation
emphasize Mr. Touchett’s coldness toward his wife
convey Mrs. Touchett’s aversion to the English climate

content.answer: provide an ironic contrast to the unambiguous nature of the Touchetts’ separation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Describe the relationship between a character and a setting.
